channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ouster of Maduro government sparks celebrations among Venezuelans in South Florida
item.description: "There’s fears. There’s excitement. There’s so many years that we’ve been waiting for this. Something had to happen in Venezuela. We all need the free...

item.title: To Trump, on Venezuela: You Break It, You Own It
item.description: His administration just decapitated the country’s leadership; he’s now responsible for what comes next there.

item.title: Managers of Swiss Bar Are Suspected of Negligence in Deadly Fire, Police Say
item.description: The Swiss authorities say small fireworks on beverage bottles probably ignited foam insulation on the bar’s basement ceiling, setting off the broader ...

item.title: More than 150 U.S. military aircraft were used in the operation to capture Venezuela’s Maduro, including stealth fighters and bombers
item.description: “This thing was so organized,” Trump said. “And they go into a dark space with machine guns facing them all over the place.”

item.title: What happens next in Venezuela? The regime’s foundation remains in place even after U.S. capture of Maduro, analyst says
item.description: "So removing Maduro did not necessarily change the fundamental equation of control."

item.title: Trump makes it clear shocking Venezuelan regime change is largely about oil: ‘They stole our oil … We’re going to make a lot of money’
item.description: Trump says American oil companies will rebuild the Venezuelan industry and take a "tremendous amount of wealth out of the ground."

item.title: An ‘Avoidable Tragedy’: The Hazards That Led to the Swiss Fire Disaster
item.description: The fire that killed at least 40 people in a Swiss bar on New Year’s Day was made more likely by apparent flaws in the site’s design and management, e...

item.title: The Trump Administration Approved a Big Lithium Mine. A Top Official’s Husband Profited.
item.description: Karen Budd-Falen, the No. 3 at the Interior Department, didn’t disclose a $3.5 million water-rights contract between her husband and the developers of...

item.title: Trump says ‘we’re going to run’ Venezuela and is not afraid to put U.S. troops on the ground after Maduro’s capture
item.description: "We're not afraid of boots on the ground. We're not afraid of it. We're we don't mind saying it, and we're gonna make sure that that country is run pr...

item.title: See How Maduro's Capture Unfolded After U.S. Strikes in Venezuela
item.description: On Saturday, U.S. military forces carried out airstrikes in Venezuela and captured the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro. President Trump said he wa...

item.title: Venezuela Live Updates: Trump Says U.S. Will ‘Run the Country’ After Capture of Maduro
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez, Venezuela’s vice president who was sworn in as interim leader, contradicted President Trump by rejecting U.S. intervention and demand...

item.title: Delcy Rodríguez, Venezuela’s new leader, boasts leftist credentials
item.description: The interim leader is known for hewing to left-wing ideals, facing sanctions by the U.S. and European Union and building bridges with Venezuela’s busi...

item.title: Trump Shares Photo of Captured Nicolás Maduro, Blindfolded and Handcuffed
item.description: The Venezuelan president and his wife were flown out of Caracas by helicopter to the U.S.S. Iwo Jima, a warship taking them to New York.

item.title: World Leaders React With Shock and Skepticism After U.S. Captures Maduro
item.description: Several Latin American leaders responded with anger, while European leaders were more cautious. President Trump’s audacious raid drew support, too.

item.title: Trump administration declines to back Venezuela’s opposition leader.
